paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the p.Ile88Leu variant in the TTR gene, focusing on its clinical significance, patient demographics, and treatment outcomes.

patients.demographics: Median age 73 years (IQR: 9), age at diagnosis 72 years (IQR: 10)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A total of 22 patients were included in the study; the median age was 73 years (IQR: 9), the age at diagnosis was 72 years (IQR: 10), and the disease duration was 1.6 years (IQR: 2.3).

functional_data.summary: The p.Ile88Leu variant is associated with a high mortality rate and significant neurological symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study provides real-world evidence on the effectiveness of patisiran in patients with this variant.
key_quotes: The most common variant in patients and asymptomatic carriers is p.Ile88Leu.
We observed stability of all considered neurological and cardiological parameters at 9–12 months after the beginning of patisiran treatment.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific variant in the TTR gene.
